page.title: 04The Abbey near Laughton
page.content: The most important ancient ruin in our area is Roche Abbey. Everyone knows about it and everyone around here has visited it. It is a very old ruin. Cistercian monks started to build it in the year 1147. The abbey took a long time to build because it wasn't finished until some time in the 15th century. Nowadays all that is left of the buildings are two large walls on the eastern side with arches and windows in. You can tell by its stonework that it must have been a beautiful building. All that is left are the two walls and lots of low walls which outline other parts. The abbey would probably still be standing today but in 1538 it was taken over by King Henry VIII. He allowed all the local people to take away stone,wood and lead.It's a shame.
